attributes.action: Reduce TFL train fares for full-time University students
attributes.background: Students who attend University in fulltime education argue that the TFL Train fares are too "expensive" for them as well as having to pay for tuition fees, student accommodation, learning resources and other costs. Those who use TFL on a regular basis to commute to University should have to pay less

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. It is the responsibility of the London Assembly.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here:

https://www.london.gov.uk/mayor-assembly/london-assembly/take-part/petitions
